original: Harold: I can't begin to imagine the hardship that she must have gone through.
translation: Harold: 我无法想象她的经历有多艰辛。

original: Harold: I've had my disagreements with William.[p/] But it's regretful that [i]this[/i] is how his story ended.
translation: Harold: 我曾与威廉有过纠纷。[p/]但他的故事<u>如此</u>结束实在是太遗憾了。

original: He seems sincere when he says that...
translation: 他似乎是真心这么想……

original: But you should still be wary.[p/] You never know who you can truly trust.
translation: 但你应保持警惕。[p/]你永远也不知道能相信谁。

original: Celeste: So...[p/] [i]Harold Haroldson[/i] is your real name?
translation: Celeste: 所以说……[p/]<u>哈罗德·哈罗德森</u>是你的真名？

original: Harold: Of course.[p/] My name has been passed down for generations.
translation: Harold: 当然是。[p/]我的姓名是世代相传的。

original: So, this wasn't a one-time occurrence.
translation: 所以这并非一次偶然。

original: Celeste: ...Is this a cultural thing?
translation: Celeste: ……这是某种文化吗？

original: Celeste: I know I haven't been back in Wyverngarde for a while.[p/] But I don't remember redundant names like this being normal.
translation: Celeste: 我知道我离开维文加德有段时间了。[p/]但我不记得这种自我重复的名字很常见。

original: Tyrion: No...[p/] It's [i]definitely[/i] unique to him...
translation: Tyrion: 不……[p/]这是他<u>独有</u>的……

original: Harold: These thefts are extremely concerning.
translation: Harold: 盗窃真的非常让人担心。

original: Harold: I had these exhibits abjured with the strongest spells gold could buy.[p/] But perhaps it wasn't enough.
translation: Harold: 我用黄金能买到的最强法术来防护这些展品。[p/]但可能这还不够。

original: Harold: ...But to think that one of my artifacts would be used for [i]murder[/i] of all things.
translation: Harold: ……想不到我的藏品之一竟会被用来实施<u>谋杀</u>。

original: Harold: ...If there's any silver lining to this,[p/] it's that the Earrings of Vitality were left untouched.
translation: Harold: ……活力耳环还完好无损，[p/]这倒是不幸中的万幸。

original: Harold: I was almost worried that I wouldn't be able to use them anymore.
translation: Harold: 我都担心再也用不了这些东西了。

original: Celeste: That was a joke...[p/] Right?
translation: Celeste: 那只是个玩笑……[p/]对吧？

original: Tyrion: It's clear why the Sword of Spell Eating was stolen.[p/] But I'm still not sure how the Armbands of Intellect fit into everything...
translation: Tyrion: 噬法之剑失窃的原因很明显。[p/]但我仍不确定智慧臂章与这些案件有什么关联……

original: Harold: ...While unlikely,[p/] it's possible that the thefts are coincidental.
translation: Harold: ……尽管不太可能，[p/]但这两次盗窃可能只是偶然。

original: But there's no way that can be true.
translation: 但这不可能是真的。

original: ...Although,[p/] it [i]might[/i] explain why the thefts were so different from each other.
translation: ……尽管，[p/]这种说法<u>也许</u>能解释为何两次盗窃的风格如此不同。

original: Tyrion: What can you tell me about this, Mr. Haroldson?
translation: Tyrion: 关于这个你有什么看法吗，哈罗德森先生？

original: Harold: ...
translation: Harold: ……

original: Harold: Sorry.[p/] I'm not really sure what to make of this.
translation: Harold: 抱歉。[p/]我不知道能说什么。

original: You return to the gallery and see a legion of knights inspecting the crime scene.
translation: 你回到了画廊，看到一群骑士正调查犯罪现场。

original: However,[p/] you don't see Mr. Haroldson anywhere.
translation: 然而，[p/]在这附近没找到哈罗德森先生。

original: The Inquisition must be questioning him.[p/] Perhaps you should follow another lead while you wait for him to return.
translation: 裁判所一定正在盘问他。[p/]或许你应该先调查其他线索。

original: Harold: ... [mind="This is a complete mess..."/]
translation: Harold: …… [mind="这真是一团糟……"/]

original: As you enter the gallery,[p/] you spot Haroldson inspecting the shattered remnants of a display case.
translation: 进入画廊时，[p/]你看到哈罗德森正在检查展柜的碎片。

original: If you recall correctly,[p/] the display case that he's looking at once held the Sword of Spell Eating.
translation: 如果你没记错，[p/]他正在看的展柜里原本保存着噬法之剑。

original: Harold: Oh, Mr. Cuthbert.[p/] I had a feeling I'd be seeing you again. [mind="He's working for the Crown Prince. Can he be trusted?"/]
translation: Harold: 噢，卡斯伯特先生。[p/]我就觉得我们会再见面。 [mind="他为王储殿下工作，值得信任吗？"/]

original: ...It seems word has spread about your deal with Aster.
translation: ……看来你和阿斯特的事已经传开了。

original: Tyrion: Hello again, Mr. Haroldson.
translation: Tyrion: 又见面了，哈罗德森先生。

original: Harold: Harold.
translation: Harold: 哈罗德。

original: Tyrion: R-[p/][s/]Right...[p/] Harold.[p/] I'm sure you already know that I'm investigating the murder of William Frega.
translation: Tyrion: 好、[p/][s/]好的……[p/]哈罗德。[p/]你应该已经知道，我在调查威廉·弗雷加被谋杀一案。

original: Tyrion: And the prosecution suspects that someone used the Sword of Spell Eating to break into Lord Frega's room.
translation: Tyrion: 检方怀疑，有人利用噬法之剑闯进了弗雷加勋爵的房间。

original: Tyrion: I was wondering if I could ask you some questions about the theft last night.
translation: Tyrion: 我想问问你关于谋杀当晚发生的窃案。

original: Harold: I'll tell you what I can.[p/] But I'm not sure how much help I'll be.
translation: Harold: 我会尽可能回答的，[p/]但我也不知道能帮上多少忙。

original: Tyrion: Thank you for your time, Harold.
translation: Tyrion: 谢谢你的合作，哈罗德。

original: Harold: Harold.
translation: Harold: 哈罗德。

original: Tyrion: I think we'll be on our way now.
translation: Tyrion: 我们差不多该走了。

original: Celeste: We have a lot of info,[p/] but none of it really leads anywhere.
translation: Celeste: 我们收获了不少情报，[p/]但没有哪条指向明确。

original: Tyrion: So many people had a motive to murder William Frega...[p/] But who actually did it?
translation: Tyrion: 许多人都有杀害威廉·弗雷加的动机……[p/]但谁付诸行动了呢？

original: Perhaps you should take some time to review everything that you've learned.
translation: 也许你应该花点时间，回顾一下至今为止的情报。

original: Tyrion: Motives aside,[p/] let's go over the events that happened that night.
translation: Tyrion: 先不谈动机，[p/]我们回顾一下谋杀当晚发生了什么事。

original: Tyrion: It all started when the Sword of Spell Eating was stolen.
translation: Tyrion: 一切都从噬法之剑被偷开始。

original: Tyrion: We don't have a specific suspect.[p/] But we do know something about them.
translation: Tyrion: 我们没有特定嫌疑人。[p/]但我们知道一些可以缩小范围的情报。

original: No...[p/] We don't know who specifically stole the sword that night.
translation: 不……[p/]我们不知道那晚具体是谁偷走了剑。

original: But we [i]do[/i] know some traits about them due to what we found in the gallery.
translation: 但根据画廊发现的东西，我们可以<u>知道</u>某些特征。

original: Harold: It would be one thing to dispel the wards and remove the glass protecting it.
translation: Harold: 解除结界，移除玻璃是一回事。

original: Harold: But it's another thing [i]entirely[/i] to completely annihilate the abjuration wards and [i]shatter[/i] the glass.
translation: Harold: <u>彻底</u>摧毁防护术结界，并<u>打碎</u>这些玻璃就是另一回事了。

original: Harold: Doing something like that would require an extremely powerful spell.[p/] Far more powerful than what would have been needed.
translation: Harold: 这样做需要使用一种极其强大的法术。[p/]远比简单破坏所需要的威力大得多。

original: Tyrion: The thief was a powerful mage.
translation: Tyrion: 窃贼是一个强大的法师。

original: Tyrion: That's the only way that they could have shattered the magically reinforced glass.
translation: Tyrion: 只有一种方法能彻底摧毁被魔法强化过的玻璃。

original: Celeste: But what about Harold?[p/] He could have just unlocked it using his password.
translation: Celeste: 那哈罗德呢？[p/]他用密码就可以解锁展柜。

original: Tyrion: He could have stolen the Sword and staged a robbery.[p/] But he couldn't have shattered the glass.
translation: Tyrion: 他可以偷走剑并行窃，[p/]但他没法这样打碎玻璃。

original: Tyrion: Only a powerful mage could have done that.[p/] And I doubt Harold would lie about that when we could easily confirm it with Steelwind.
translation: Tyrion: 只有强大的法师才能做到这种地步。[p/]找斯蒂尔文德确证很简单，我不觉得哈罗德会在这种事上说谎。

original: Celeste: Right.[p/] But then what happened next?
translation: Celeste: 也对。[p/]那之后发生了什么？

original: Tyrion: They brazenly stole the Sword of Spell Eating.[p/] This caused Harold to report the theft to the Kingsguard.
translation: Tyrion: 犯人公然偷走噬法之剑。[p/]哈罗德发现后向国王卫队报告。

original: Aria: After Lord Haroldson reported the theft,[p/] the Inquisition discreetly placed the manor on lockdown.
translation: Aria: 哈罗德森勋爵通报失窃一事后，[p/]裁判所慎重地封锁了庄园。

original: Aria: They searched every room in the manor to try to find it.
translation: Aria: 为寻找剑，他们搜查了庄园所有房间。

original: Aria: But it was eventually found in Beatrice's bedroom.
translation: Aria: 最终剑在比亚特丽丝的卧室被发现。

original: Tyrion: ...And that led them to believe that [i]she[/i] had stolen it.
translation: Tyrion: ……所以他们认为是<u>她</u>偷了剑。

original: Aria: That's correct.[p/] The Kingsguard moved to arrest her,[p/] but Prince Aster ordered them to step down.
translation: Aria: 是的。[p/]国王卫队准备逮捕她，[p/]但阿斯特王子阻止了他们。

original: Tyrion: And then there's Laefe's statement.
translation: Tyrion: 然后是拉菲说的话。

original: Liafal: My father was extremely upset about something.[p/] I think Beatrice may have offended him during their meeting.
translation: Liafal: 我父亲因为什么事非常生气。[p/]我觉得比亚特丽丝在会面期间可能冒犯了他。

original: Liafal: The servants said that he wanted to be left alone.[p/] He retreated into his study immediately after their meeting.
translation: Liafal: 仆人们说他想一个人待着。[p/]他在会面后马上就回到了自己的书房。

original: Liafal: I tried to speak with him when the theft was reported.[p/] But he didn't much care about the missing artifact.
translation: Liafal: 盗窃案上报时我试图找他谈谈。[p/]但他对丢失的遗物不是很在意。

original: Liafal: This happened before they activated the lockdown.[p/] It was a little after 1:00 AM that night.
translation: Liafal: 激活封锁之前，[p/]晚上凌晨 1:00 刚过不久。

original: Tyrion: Laefe's account gives us a clear fact about [i]when[/i] William died.
translation: Tyrion: 拉菲的证词说明了有关威廉死亡<u>时间</u>的明确事实。

original: No...[p/] Laefe spoke with Lord Frega before he went into his study.
translation: 不……[p/]弗雷加勋爵回到书房前曾与拉菲谈话。

original: And unlike the Nightgrave case,[p/] the time of death was [i]after[/i] this encounter.
translation: 与奈特格雷夫一案不同的是，[p/]死亡时间是在这次相遇<u>之后</u>。

original: It's unlikely that Laefe saw someone else disguised as her father.
translation: 拉菲看见的不太可能是别人伪装的威廉。

original: It [i]had[/i] to have been him.
translation: <u>一定</u>是他本人。

original: Tyrion: William Frega was murdered [i]after[/i] the lockdown was activated.
translation: Tyrion: 威廉·弗雷加在封锁被激活<u>之后</u>遭杀害。

original: Celeste: This means that whoever killed him bypassed the lockdown and broke into the magically locked room.
translation: Celeste: 意味着凶手肯定绕过了封锁系统，闯入了被魔法封锁的房间。

original: Celeste: They [i]had[/i] to have used the Sword, right?
translation: Celeste: 他们<u>肯定</u>用了噬法之剑，对吧？

original: Tyrion: ...That's likely,[p/] but not necessarily true.
translation: Tyrion: ……很有可能，[p/]但不算“肯定”。

original: Tyrion: An [b]Anti-Magic Field[/b] would have also had the same effect.
translation: Tyrion: [b]抗魔力场[/b]也能有相同的效果。

original: Tyrion: The murderer could have stolen the Sword of Spell-Eating to throw off the investigation.
translation: Tyrion: 凶手偷窃噬法之剑也可能是想让调查误入歧途。

original: Celeste: But [b]Anti-Magic Field[/b] is a high-level spell.[p/] Not many mages would be able to cast it.
translation: Celeste: 但[b]抗魔力场[/b]属于高阶法术。[p/]没多少法师会用。

original: Tyrion: ...And I doubt [i]any[/i] of the nobles here will let us see their [b]Spell Compendiums[/b].
translation: Tyrion: ……我也不觉得这里的<u>哪一个</u>贵族会让我们察看[b]法术汇编[/b]。

original: Tyrion: But because of how powerful [b]Anti-Magic Field[/b] is,[p/] we can still conclude that the murderer is a powerful mage.
translation: Tyrion: 不过既然[b]抗魔力场[/b]威力不俗，[p/]我们还是可以确定凶手是位强大的法师。

original: Tyrion: This actually narrows down our list of suspects.
translation: Tyrion: 这也帮我们缩小了嫌疑人的范围。

original: Celeste: That's still not concrete evidence, though...
translation: Celeste: 但这还不算是确凿的证据……

original: Celeste: And we haven't even spoken to all of the suspects yet.
translation: Celeste: 我们也还没和所有嫌疑人交谈过。

original: Right...[p/] You never got a chance to speak with Lucio Steelwind.
translation: 是啊……[p/]你一直没机会和卢西奥·斯蒂尔文德交谈。

original: But given his status,[p/] you wonder if that would even be possible.
translation: 但考虑到他的地位，[p/]你觉得这件事希望渺茫。

original: Tyrion: Either way,[p/] it's a good start.[p/] And it's not as if we're defending this case.
translation: Tyrion: 总之，[p/]算个好的开头。[p/]反正也不是我们来辩护此案。

original: Tyrion: The trial is getting close anyways.
translation: Tyrion: 审理也快开始了。

original: You don't doubt Ms. Tymora's abilities.[p/] But you should share what you've learned with her before the trial begins.
translation: 你不怀疑泰摩拉女士的能力。[p/]但你还是应该在庭审开始前，与她分享自己所知的情报。

original: It's a little strange that you haven't seen her since the investigation began.
translation: 调查开始后你就没见过她，这稍微有点奇怪。

original: But she might be meeting with Beatrice at the Dungeon.
translation: 也许她正在地牢与比亚特丽丝会面。

original: Tyrion: It's a crimson-red short sword.
translation: Tyrion: 一把深红色的短剑。

original: Harold: That's the Sword of Spell Eating.
translation: Harold: 这就是噬法之剑。

original: Harold: Legends say that it has the power to protect its wielder from [i]any[/i] kind of magic.
translation: Harold: 传说中提到，这把剑能让使用者不受<u>任何</u>形式的魔法影响。

original: Tyrion: So it's like an [b]Anti-Magic Field[/b].
translation: Tyrion: 就像一个[b]抗魔力场[/b]。

original: Harold: In a way, yes.[p/] But it has less-than-heroic origins, I'm afraid.
translation: Harold: 某种意义上是的。[p/]但这把剑的起源恐怕不怎么光明。

original: Harold: It's said that this sword was created through a blood pact between a mage and a demon.
translation: Harold: 传说这把剑是通过法师与恶魔的血契打造而成。

original: Tyrion: A demon?
translation: Tyrion: 恶魔？

original: Harold: Legends say that some demons had the power to absorb and nullify magic.
translation: Harold: 传说提到，有的恶魔能够吸收魔法，使之无效化。

original: Harold: A demon must have imbued some of that power into this sword.
translation: Harold: 肯定是某个恶魔将自己的力量灌入了这把剑。

original: Harold: Or at least that's what the legends say.
translation: Harold: 至少传说里这么讲。

original: Tyrion: ...Is it safe to put something like this on display?
translation: Tyrion: ……把这种东西展示出来安全吗？

original: Tyrion: What if the legends are true?
translation: Tyrion: 万一传说是真的呢？

original: Harold: Don't worry.[p/] These displays are fortified with several [b]abjuration[/b] spells.
translation: Harold: 别担心。[p/]这些展柜都有多层[b]防护术[/b]类法术保护。

original: Harold: I'd bet even Lord Steelwind would have trouble getting into this.
translation: Harold: 即使斯蒂尔文德勋爵也没法轻易破坏。

original: Tyrion: It's a pair of golden earrings.[p/] There are small jewels embedded into each of them.
translation: Tyrion: 一对金制耳环。[p/]每个耳环上都有珠宝点缀。

original: Harold: Those are the Earrings of Vitality.
translation: Harold: 这是活力耳环。

original: Harold: It's said that the Scaled Lord imbued a portion of his immortality into these.
translation: Harold: 传说鳞甲领主将自己的一部分不朽之力灌入其中。

original: Harold: Legends say that whoever wore them would have their lifespan increased ten-fold.
translation: Harold: 传说提到，穿戴耳环的人生命力都会变为原有的十倍。

original: Tyrion: The Scaled Lord could do things like that?
translation: Tyrion: 鳞甲领主还能做到这种事？

original: Harold: Of course![p/] He is [i]the[/i] Scaled Lord, after all.
translation: Harold: 当然了！[p/]毕竟他可是<u>那个</u>鳞甲领主。

original: Tyrion: Hm...[p/] Are there any spells that can create a similar effect to these earrings?
translation: Tyrion: 嗯……[p/]有没有什么和这对耳环效果相似的法术？

original: Harold: Not that I know of.
translation: Harold: 我了解的范围里没有。

original: Harold: A spell like that would probably fall under the school of [b]necromancy[/b].
translation: Harold: 这种法术大概率会被归为[b]死灵术[/b]。

original: Harold: ...And I'm sure you know how much the kingdom scrutinizes [i]that[/i] type of magic.
translation: Harold: ……你也知道王国对<u>这类</u>法术审查有多么严格。

original: Tyrion: It's a pair of metallic armbands.[p/] There are several magical runes carved onto them.
translation: Tyrion: 一对金属臂章。[p/]上面镶嵌着数个魔法符石。

original: Harold: Those are the Armbands of Intellect.
translation: Harold: 这是智慧臂章。

original: Harold: They were actually created by a member of House Frega many centuries ago.
translation: Harold: 其实是由弗雷加家族的某位成员在许多世纪前创造。

original: Tyrion: "Centuries"?[p/] That would make these armbands one of the first creations of artificery.
translation: Tyrion: “许多世纪”？[p/]那这对臂章就是奥术能源最早的一批产物之一了。

original: Harold: That's correct.[p/] Legends say that whoever wore these armbands would be granted unparalleled levels of intellect.
translation: Harold: 正是如此。[p/]传说提到，佩戴臂章的生物会获得无可匹敌的智力。

original: Harold: Many believed that House Frega created these to aid them in their study of magic.
translation: Harold: 很多人相信，弗雷加家创造臂章是为了帮助家族研究魔法。

original: Tyrion: It's a painting of some sort of scientist.
translation: Tyrion: 看起来是某个科学家的画像。

original: Harold: That man is Dr. Luke Kuepfer.[p/] He was an alchemist and inventor from one of the branch families.
translation: Harold: 那是 Luke Kuepfer 博士。[p/]他是出身于弗雷加一族分家的炼金术师和发明家。

original: Harold: He is well-known for his studies into imbuing intelligence into automatons.
translation: Harold: 他因对人工智能机器人的研究而著名。

original: Tyrion: Intelligent automatons...[p/] Would that make them similar to Arcane Constructs?
translation: Tyrion: 智能机器人……[p/]会和奥术构造体很相似吗？

original: Harold: Yes, actually.[p/] I wouldn't be surprised if Lord von Sanctus used Dr. Kuepfer's research to create those Constructs.
translation: Harold: 没错，正是如此。[p/]冯·桑克图斯勋爵制造那些构造体时，使用了 Kuepfer 博士的研究成果也不足为奇。

original: So in essence,[p/] von Sanctus is taking credit for someone else's work.
translation: 所以从本质上来讲，[p/]冯·桑克图斯是在抢别人功劳。

original: Tyrion: It's a painting of a researcher.
translation: Tyrion: 一幅研究员的画像。

original: Harold: That is Professor Matt Ferland.[p/] He was a professor of some renown.
translation: Harold: 那是 Matt Ferland 教授。[p/]他是个小有名声的教授。

original: Harold: He was a researcher of Combinatorial Magic Theory.
translation: Harold: 他钻研组合魔法理论。

original: Tyrion: What's that?
translation: Tyrion: 那是什么？

original: Harold: It's the study of how different types of magic interact with each other.
translation: Harold: 是种研究不同种类的魔法互相交融的理论。

original: Harold: He famously ran an experiment on what would happen if two [b]Anti-magic Fields[/b] overlapped each other.
translation: Harold: 他以进行双[b]抗魔力场[/b]重合实验而闻名。

original: Tyrion: ...That's actually pretty interesting.[p/] What were the results of the experiment?
translation: Tyrion: ……那确实挺有意思的。[p/]实验结果如何？

original: Harold: Well, they had mages enter the space where the two fields overlapped.
translation: Harold: 嗯，他们令一名法师进入了两个力场重合的空间。

original: Harold: It turns out that those mages [i]were[/i] able to use their magic in that space.
translation: Harold: 结果是那些法师<u>可以</u>在重合范围内使用魔法。

original: Tyrion: Wait,[p/] how would that be possible?[p/] They would have had two [b]Anti-magic Fields[/b] affecting them.
translation: Tyrion: 等下，[p/]这怎么可能？[p/]他们应该被两个[b]抗魔力场[/b]所影响啊。

original: Harold: When the two fields overlapped they canceled each other out.[p/] I've heard that it's akin to multiplying two negative numbers together.
translation: Harold: 我听说两个力场重叠时会获得负负得正的效果。

original: Tyrion: So what is a historian doing at the Lords' Ball, Mr. Haroldson?
translation: Tyrion: 哈罗德森先生，你一个历史学家为什么会来参加勋爵的舞会呢？

original: Harold: Harold.
translation: Harold: 哈罗德。

original: Tyrion: Um...[p/] right,[p/] Harold.
translation: Tyrion: 唔……[p/]好吧，[p/]哈罗德。

original: Harold: Anyways,[p/] Lord Frega invites my museum to set up some displays here every year. [mind="He must think it adds a semblance of culture, the fool."/]
translation: Harold: 言归正传，[p/]弗雷加勋爵每年都邀请我从博物馆中选取几样物品来这里展示。[mind="他一定以为这样能增加文化气息，这个蠢货。"/]

original: Tyrion: You own a museum?
translation: Tyrion: 你有个博物馆？

original: Harold: Yes.[p/] It's the Haroldson Hall of History,[p/] located in the city of Homherith.
translation: Harold: 对的。[p/]名为哈罗德森历史长廊，[p/]就在霍姆歇里斯城。

original: That's...[p/] a mouthful.
translation: 那可真是……[p/]拗口。

original: Harold: Unfortunately,[p/] I don't think his guests appreciate the historical significance of these items.
translation: Harold: 可惜的是，[p/]我不觉得他的客人欣赏得来这些展品的历史意义。

original: Harold: Honestly,[p/] I think [i]you're[/i] the only person in years who's taken a meaningful interest in them.
translation: Harold: 说实话，[p/]我觉得这么多年来，<u>你</u>是唯一一个对这些展品产生兴趣的人。

original: Tyrion: Sorry,[p/] but I really have to ask...[p/] Is that a monkey riding on your back?
translation: Tyrion: 如果冒犯到很抱歉，[p/]但我真的想问一下……[p/]骑在你背上的那是只猴子吗？

original: Harold: Yes.[p/] This is my familiar:[p/] Eugene.
translation: Harold: 没错，[p/]这是我的使魔：[p/]尤金。

original: Tyrion: Your "familiar"?
translation: Tyrion: 你的“使魔”？

original: Harold: A familiar is a creature that a mage has formed a magical bond with.
translation: Harold: 使魔是一种与法师签订了魔法契约的生物。

original: Harold: With that bond,[p/] our souls are forever connected.
translation: Harold: 我们的灵魂通过契约联系在一起。

original: Harold: I can communicate with him telepathically.[p/] I could even cast my spells through him if I wanted to.
translation: Harold: 我能和他进行心灵感应交流。[p/]如果我愿意，甚至可以通过他施展我的魔法。

original: Tyrion: Really...?[p/] I never knew a spell like that existed.
translation: Tyrion: 真的吗……？我从来不知道还有这种法术。

original: Harold: It's quite rare.[p/] Very few mages take the time to learn how to cast it.
translation: Harold: 这种法术很罕见。[p/]很少有法师会花时间学习施展方法。

original: Harold: Eugene helps me with my day-to-day.
translation: Harold: 尤金每天都在帮我的忙。

original: Harold: These old bones aren't as spry as they used to be, after all.
translation: Harold: 毕竟我的这副老骨头不如以前一样轻快了。

original: Tyrion: Mr.-[p/] Um, I mean, Harold.
translation: Tyrion: 哈罗德森先-[p/]呃，这个，哈罗德。

original: Harold: Harold.
translation: Harold: 哈罗德。

original: Tyrion: As a historian,[p/] do you have a lot of knowledge about the ancient dragons?
translation: Tyrion: 作为一名历史学家，[p/]你对古龙有所了解吗？

original: Harold: Hm...[p/] The answer to that question is somewhat complicated.
translation: Harold: 嗯……[p/]回答有点复杂。

original: Tyrion: What do you mean?
translation: Tyrion: 这是为什么？

original: Harold: Unfortunately,[p/] a lot of historical texts in my collection have been altered or even outright destroyed by the Church of Bahamut.
translation: Harold: 不幸的是，[p/]我拥有的历史文献不是被巴哈姆特教会修改过，就是被彻底销毁了。

original: Harold: Because of that,[p/] it's quite difficult to separate myths from actual historical accounts.
translation: Harold: 因此，[p/]把传说和真实的文献记录区分开来是挺困难的。

original: Tyrion: Right...[p/] I remember encountering a similar problem at the Imperial Academy...
translation: Tyrion: 没错……[p/]我记得在帝国学院时也遇到过类似的问题……

original: Harold: Ah,[p/] you must be quite dedicated to your studies. [mind="They let this simpleton into the Imperial Academy?!"/]
translation: Harold: 啊，[p/]看来你一定很用功吧。 [mind="他们让这个呆瓜进了帝国学院？！"/]

original: Rude...[p/] But you suppose that can't be helped.
translation: 没礼貌……[p/]但这也没办法。

original: Harold: I had to fight the Church for a long time before I could even display dragon bones in my museum.
translation: Harold: 我和教会斗智斗勇，才能在我的博物馆里展放龙骨。

original: Tyrion: In the history of the ancient dragons,[p/] was there any instance of them granting powers to humans?
translation: Tyrion: 在古龙的历史中，[p/]有将神力赐给人类的例子吗？

original: Harold: Well,[p/] of course![p/] That's the entire premise behind the seven heroes of Wyverngarde! [mind="Does this idiot not even know about that?"/]
translation: Harold: 嗯，[p/]当然有！[p/]这可是维文加德七英雄的前提！[mind="这蠢货连<u>这</u>都不知道？"/]

original: Tyrion: ...Right.[p/] But was there anything before that?
translation: Tyrion: ……好吧。[p/]这之前呢？

original: Tyrion: Did they ever grant supernatural abilities that [i]didn't[/i] follow the rules of Arcane Magic?
translation: Tyrion: 他们赋予的超自然能力里有没有<u>不</u>遵循奥术魔法规则的？

original: Harold: Hm...[p/] Granting supernatural abilities, you say?
translation: Harold: 嗯……[p/]你说赋予超自然能力？

original: Harold: That sounds more like something [i]demonic[/i] in nature,[p/] rather than draconic.
translation: Harold: 比起龙的力量，听起来更像是<u>恶魔</u>的力量。

original: Tyrion: D-[p/][s/]Demonic...?
translation: Tyrion: 恶、[p/][s/]恶魔的力量……？

original: Harold: Much like the ancient dragons,[p/] demons are the stuff of myths.
translation: Harold: 和古龙一样，[p/]恶魔也是神话里的内容。

original: Harold: There are many stories of people selling their souls to them for untold power.
translation: Harold: 很多故事讲的都是人类为了获得力量，对恶魔出卖自己的灵魂。

original: "Selling" their souls?!
translation: “出卖”灵魂？！

original: Tyrion: So what is a historian doing at the Lords' Ball, Mr. Haroldson?
translation: Tyrion: 哈罗德森先生，你一个历史学家为什么会来参加勋爵的舞会呢？

original: Harold: Harold.
translation: Harold: 哈罗德。

original: Tyrion: Um...[p/] right,[p/] Harold.
translation: Tyrion: 唔……[p/]好吧，[p/]哈罗德。

original: Harold: Anyways,[p/] Lord Frega invites my museum to set up some displays here every year. [mind="He must think it adds a semblance of culture, the philistine."/]
translation: Harold: 言归正传，[p/]弗雷加勋爵每年都邀请我从我的博物馆中选取几样物品来这里展示。[mind="他一定以为这样能增加文化气息，这个蠢货。"/]

original: Tyrion: You own a museum?
translation: Tyrion: 你有个博物馆？

original: Harold: Yes.[p/] It's the Haroldson Hall of History, located in Homherith.
translation: Harold: 对的。[p/]名为哈罗德森历史长廊，[p/]就在霍姆歇里斯城。

original: ...That's a mouthful.
translation: ……那可真是拗口。

original: Harold: Unfortunately,[p/] I don't think his guests appreciate the historical significance of these items.
translation: Harold: 可惜的是，[p/]我不觉得他的客人欣赏得来这些展品的历史意义。

original: Harold: Honestly,[p/] I think [i]you're[/i] the only person in years who's taken an interest in their histories.
translation: Harold: 说实话，[p/]我觉得这么多年来，<u>你</u>是唯一一个对这些展品产生兴趣的人。

original: Tyrion: How did you obtain such powerful items anyways?
translation: Tyrion: 你是怎么获得这么厉害的遗物的？

original: Tyrion: I'd have thought that the kingdom would still have a use for these.
translation: Tyrion: 我还以为王国会利用这些东西。

original: Harold: Unfortunately,[p/] the members of the kingdom's upper-class only care about political power.
translation: Harold: 很可惜，[p/]王国上层社会的成员只在乎政治影响力。

original: Harold: These items are tools of a bygone era.
translation: Harold: 这些都是过去时代的工具。

original: Harold: I'm afraid many nobles don't see the value in them.
translation: Harold: 我想大概没多少贵族能识别出其中价值。

original: Tyrion: What can you tell me about this, Mr. Haroldson?
translation: Tyrion: 关于这个你有什么看法吗，哈罗德森先生？

original: Harold: ...
translation: Harold: ……

original: Harold: Sorry.[p/] I'm not really sure what to make of this.
translation: Harold: 抱歉。[p/]我不知道能说什么。

original: You look further around the manor and find a room with several displays.
translation: 你继续环顾庄园，发现一个放有几个展柜的房间。

original: It looks like a gallery of some sort.[p/] But it's slightly out of place here.
translation: 看起来是某种形式的画廊。[p/]在这里有点格格不入。

original: There are a few nobles in the room.[p/] And they're all silently appreciating the exhibits.
translation: 画廊里有几个贵族，[p/]他们都沉默欣赏着展览品。

original: Perhaps Lord Frega paid a museum to create some historical displays for the Lords' Ball.
translation: 也许弗雷加勋爵付钱请博物馆专门设置了这个历史文物展。

original: Harold: Now there's a face I haven't seen before...
translation: Harold: 这位先生我是头一次见……

original: As you take a closer look at one of the exhibits,[p/] an old man approaches you.
translation: 在你近距离察看其中一件展示品时，[p/]一位老人接近了你。

original: Is that...[p/][s/] a monkey on his back?!
translation: 他背上是只……[p/][s/]猴子？！

original: Harold: Hello, my name is Harold Haroldson.[p/] I'm the curator of this collection.
translation: Harold: 你好。我叫哈罗德·哈罗德森。[p/]是这些收藏品的管理人。

original: Tyrion: "Harold Haroldson"...?[p/] Is that a pseudonym or something?
translation: Tyrion: “哈罗德·哈罗德森”……？[p/]是什么代号吗？

original: Harold: No.
translation: Harold: 不是。

original: Tyrion: ...I see.
translation: Tyrion: ……我明白了。

original: Wait...[p/] He's a museum curator?
translation: 等等……[p/]他是个博物馆管理人？

original: He must be extremely knowledgeable about Wyverngarde's history.
translation: 那他肯定熟知维文加德历史。

original: You wonder...
translation: 你在想……

original: Tyrion: ...Would you happen to know anything about the Ancient Dragons?
translation: Tyrion: ……你知不知道任何关于古龙的事情？

original: Harold: Ah, like the Scaled Lord:[p/] Rathallion.
translation: Harold: 啊，比如鳞甲领主拉萨利昂。

original: Harold: There are many pieces in this gallery.
translation: Harold: 画廊里有很多相关藏品。

original: Harold: And some of them were items that were wielded by the seven heroes of Wyverngarde.
translation: Harold: 有些甚至曾被维文加德七英雄使用过。

original: Harold: Legends say that some of these items were directly enchanted by Rathallion himself.
translation: Harold: 传说提到，有些物品甚至是由拉萨利昂亲自附魔。

original: "Enchanted by Rathallion"?[p/] Would that mean that they [i]also[/i] don't follow the rules of magic?
translation: “拉萨利昂亲自附魔”？[p/]所以这些物品<u>也</u>不受魔法规则限制？

original: Perhaps you should EXAMINE these items more closely.
translation: 也许你应该更仔细地 <size=1.5em>检查</size> 这些物品。

original: You recall the note that your mother left for you before she was executed.
translation: 你回忆起母亲被处决之前留给你的信息。

original: Frey: Use my eyes.[p/] Peer beyond the Divine Gate as I once did.
translation: Frey: 用我的眼睛吧。[p/]仔细看那神圣之门外的世界，就像我之前做的那样。

original: She told you to use "her" eyes...
translation: 她让你用“她的”眼睛……

original: Did your mother make a deal with a demon to give you the Eye of Horus?!
translation: 难道母亲是和恶魔做了交易，才给你留下荷鲁斯之眼？！

original: Harold: ...Is something wrong? [mind="This simpleton is far too superstitious."/]
translation: Harold: ……出什么事了吗？ [mind="这个呆瓜也太迷信了。"/]

original: Tyrion: N-[p/]No...[p/] Nothing's wrong.
translation: Tyrion: 不、[p/]不……[p/]没事。

original: It's a bit too much to take in...[p/] But you might just be overthinking this.
translation: 信息量有点太大了……[p/]但也可能是你想多了。

original: There haven't been any recorded sightings of demons in recent history.[p/] There are only second-hand stories and superstitions.
translation: 近代历史上还没有出现过恶魔的记录。[p/]只有二手消息和迷信传闻。

original: The Eye of Horus can't possibly be demonic, can it...?
translation: 荷鲁斯之眼不可能是恶魔之力吧……？

original: You hope Celeste's investigation is going better than yours...
translation: 你希望塞莱斯特那边的调查比你顺利……

original: Tyrion: There's an air vent over here.[p/] It appears to go from the ceiling to the ground floor.
translation: Tyrion: 这里有个通风管道。[p/]看起来连接着屋顶和地板。

original: Tyrion: Is this where that "rat" escaped to, Tracker?
translation: Tyrion: 追追，那只“老鼠”就是逃进了这里吗？

original: Tracker: That's where the jumping rat went.
translation: Tracker: 会跳的老鼠去了这里。

original: Tyrion: ...I thought you said it was a "flying rat"?
translation: Tyrion: ……我以为你说的是“会飞的老鼠”？

original: Tracker: Tracker see that too.
translation: Tracker: 追追也看到了。

original: Okay...[p/] It would probably be better to just move on.
translation: 好吧……[p/]最好先继续调查。

original: Tyrion: Anyways,[p/] where did this rat come from?
translation: Tyrion: 总之，[p/]这只老鼠从哪里来的？

original: Tracker: Rat come out the other wall.
translation: Tracker: 老鼠从另一面墙来。

original: Tyrion: Do you mean the vent on the opposite side?
translation: Tyrion: 你是指另一边的通风管道？

original: Tracker: Yes.[p/] Tracker saw flying rat escape that way.
translation: Tracker: 对的。[p/]追追看见会飞的老鼠从那边逃走。

original: Hm...[p/] What was this "rat" doing here in the first place?
translation: 嗯……[p/]这只“老鼠”在那里做什么？

original: Tyrion: These crystals supposedly generated an [b]Anti-Magic Field[/b] during the lockdown.
translation: Tyrion: 这些水晶会在封锁激活后生成一个[b]抗魔力场[/b]。

original: Tyrion: However,[p/] the Sword of Spell Eating would make its wielder immune to these fields.
translation: Tyrion: 但是，[p/]噬法之剑可以让持有者免疫这些力场。

original: Celeste: ...What?
translation: Celeste: ……什么？

original: Tyrion: What do you see?
translation: Tyrion: 你看到了什么？

original: Celeste: The vents have traces of [b]illusion[/b] magic inside them.
translation: Celeste: 这些管道里有[b]幻象术[/b]魔法的痕迹。

original: Tyrion: What?
translation: Tyrion: 什么？

original: Celeste: ...The traces also go [i]deep[/i] inside these vents.
translation: Celeste: ……这些痕迹一直延伸到管道<u>深处</u>。

original: Celeste: It's the same for the vents on the other side too.
translation: Celeste: 另一侧的管道也是一样。

original: Tyrion: ...What are you doing here, Eris?
translation: Tyrion: ……你在这里干什么，厄莉斯？

original: Eris: I should be asking [i]you[/i] the same thing.
translation: Eris: 我也可以问<u>你</u>一样的问题。

original: Eris: I recall you telling me that you were a [i]defense[/i] attorney.
translation: Eris: 我记得你说自己是<u>辩护</u>律师。

original: Eris: Yet here you are,[p/] prosecuting a defendant.[p/] You're even leading the Inquisition that you supposedly hate so much.
translation: Eris: 可现在，[p/]你却在起诉别人。[p/]还带领自己痛恨至极的裁判所调查案件。

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Eris: But to answer your question,[p/] I'm here on behalf of Beatrice.
translation: Eris: 不过还是先回答你的问题，[p/]我是代表比亚特丽丝来的。

original: Liafal: My sister?
translation: Liafal: 我姐姐？

original: Eris: Yes.[p/] Tymora is occupied handling other aspects of the case.
translation: Eris: 对。[p/]泰摩拉在忙案件的其他工作。

original: Eris: So she sent me here to investigate on her behalf.
translation: Eris: 所以比亚特丽丝就派我来这里代表她调查。

original: Tyrion: ...What?[p/] She would have to trust you a lot to let you handle something so important.
translation: Tyrion: ……什么？[p/]把这么重要的事情交给你，她肯定非常信任你。

original: Tyrion: How do you two even know each other?
translation: Tyrion: 你们俩怎么认识的？

original: Tyrion: You said she was acquainted with your father, but-
translation: Tyrion: 你说她和你父亲很熟，但是——

original: Eris: Ah.[p/] [i]We[/i] met during her days at the Imperial Academy.
translation: Eris: 啊。[p/]<u>我们</u>是在她就读帝国学院时认识的。

original: Eris: We both studied [b]illusion[/b] magic together.
translation: Eris: 我们当时一起学习[b]幻象术[/b]。

original: Liafal: ...
translation: Liafal: ……

original: Eris: I've always been a patron of hers.[p/] It saddens me to see her in this dreadful situation.
translation: Eris: 我一直在帮她度过难关。[p/]看到她处境艰难让我也很难过。

original: Tyrion: What do you think about this, Eris?
translation: Tyrion: 厄莉斯，你对这个有什么想法吗？

original: Eris: Hm...[p/] No.
translation: Eris: 嗯……[p/]没有。

original: Tyrion: ...What?
translation: Tyrion: ……什么？

original: Eris: I don't seem to have any dialogue for that.
translation: Eris: 我没有这方面的台词。

original: Tyrion: I...[p/] see.
translation: Tyrion: 我……[p/]明白了。

original: [i]That's[/i] a strange way to say that she doesn't know anything about it.
translation: <u>这样</u>表达自己一无所知还真是奇怪。

original: You allow Tracker to lead you to the location where he found the Sword of Spell Eating.
translation: 你让追追带你们去了他发现噬法之剑的地方。

original: Surprisingly,[p/] it's fairly close to Beatrice's Room.
translation: 令人惊讶的是，[p/]位置距离比亚特丽丝的房间很近。

original: He apparently didn't travel very far before he met those "rats" he mentioned.
translation: 他似乎没走多远就碰到了之前提过的“老鼠们”。

original: Tracker: ...
translation: Tracker: ……

original: As you continue towards your destination,[p/] Tracker suddenly becomes extremely tense.
translation: 渐渐接近目的地时，[p/]追追突然变得极度紧张。

original: Tyrion: ...Tracker?[p/] What's wrong?
translation: Tyrion: ……追追？[p/]怎么了？

original: Tracker: Enemy.
translation: Tracker: 敌人。

original: Eris: Oh?
translation: Eris: 喔？

original: Before you even have a chance to react,[p/] Tracker steps between you and Eris and begins angrily barking at her.
translation: 你还没来得及反应，[p/]追追就已经跨步站到你和厄莉斯之间，开始冲着她愤怒地吠叫。

original: Eris: Oh, dear.
translation: Eris: 噢天啊。

original: Liafal: Tracker?![p/][s/] Stop that!
translation: Liafal: 追追？！[p/][s/]停下！

original: Laefe tries to calm Tracker down.[p/] But he's undeterred.
translation: 拉菲试图让追追冷静下来。[p/]但并没有什么效果。

original: He continues to bark at Eris.[p/] And it looks like it's taking all of Laefe's strength to hold him back.
translation: 他继续朝着厄莉斯狂吠。[p/]拉菲看起来用尽全身力气才把他拦住。

original: Liafal: I-[p/][s/]I'm terribly sorry![p/][s/] He's not usually like this.
translation: Liafal: 我、[p/][s/]我真的很抱歉！[p/][s/]他平常不会这样。

original: Eris: Ah, it's to be expected.
translation: Eris: 啊，意料之中。

original: ERIS: I'm not sure why,[p/] but animals have always been able to see me for what I am.
translation: ERIS: 我也不懂，[p/]但动物们总能看清我的真面目。

original: ERIS: I'm not sure why,[p/] but animals have always disliked me.
translation: ERIS: 我也不懂，[p/]但动物们一般都不喜欢我。

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: What [i]is[/i] Eris doing here?
translation: 厄莉斯在这干嘛？

original: You recall seeing her at the Barracks too.
translation: 记得在收容处也看见过她。

original: She said that her father is friends with Beatrice,[p/] but is she involved in this case somehow?
translation: 她说过她父亲是比亚特丽丝的朋友，[p/]但她是否与此案有某种牵连？

original: Anyways,[p/] you came here for a purpose.[p/] You should EXAMINE this hallway and see if you can find any clues.
translation: 总之，[p/]你是有目的而来的。[p/]你应该 <size=1.5em>调查</size> 这条走廊，看看有没有什么线索。

original: Tyrion: Why would there be traces of [b]illusion[/b] magic [i]inside[/i] the vents...
translation: Tyrion: 为什么管道里有[b]幻象术[/b]魔法的痕迹……

original: Tyrion: What spell could have possibly left those traces?
translation: Tyrion: 什么法术能留下这种魔法痕迹呢？

original: Eris: As I told you many months ago,[p/] [b]illusion[/b] spells tend to do one of two things.
translation: Eris: 正如我几个月前和你说的，[p/][b]幻象术[/b]的效果不出两种。

original: Eris: They either create free-standing illusions,[p/] or they can disguise an existing creature.
translation: Eris: 要么创造一个独立的幻象，[p/]要么能伪装现有的生物。

original: Tyrion: I doubt someone created a small free-standing illusion in the vents.[p/] So a disguised creature must have been [i]inside[/i] these vents at some point.
translation: Tyrion: 我怀疑某人在管道里创造了一个独立的小型幻象。[p/]所以在某个时间点，<u>管道内</u>一定有某个伪装过的生物。

original: Celeste: But these vents are tiny.[p/] [i]No one[/i] would be able to fit inside them.
translation: Celeste: 但这些管道很小。[p/]<u>没人</u>能钻进去。

original: Tyrion: ...
translation: Tyrion: ……

original: Tracker: Tracker could see them now.[p/] So Tracker did one final bork to scare them off.
translation: Tracker: 追追看到它们了。[p/]然后追追大叫一声把它们吓跑了。

original: Tracker: The rats were scared and went back into the walls.
translation: Tracker: 老鼠非常害怕，又钻回墙里去了。

original: Tyrion: ...But a [i]rat[/i] would be able to fit in these vents.
translation: Tyrion: ……但一只<u>老鼠</u>应该能钻进这些管道里。

original: Celeste: Well, yeah.[p/] I guess that'd be true.
translation: Celeste: 哦，对。[p/]那倒是没问题。

original: Celeste: But that would mean that rat had an [b]illusion[/b] spell active on it at the time.
translation: Celeste: 但那就意味着那只老鼠当时身上有生效的[b]幻象术[/b]。

original: Tyrion: It's not only that...
translation: Tyrion: 不只如此……

original: He said that the "queen finally answered" him.[p/] And this happened after he picked up a "stick".
translation: 他说“女皇最终回应了”他。[p/]而那是在他捡起“棍子”之后发生的。

original: But that shouldn't have been possible because of the [b]Anti-Magic Field[/b]
translation: 但由于[b]抗魔力场[/b]的存在，那应该是不可能的。

original: Tyrion: Tracker saw this "rat" [i]during[/i] the lockdown.
translation: Tyrion: 追追在封锁<u>期间</u>看见了这只“老鼠”。

original: Celeste: ...They would have been inside the [b]Anti-Magic Field[/b] created by the lockdown.
translation: Celeste: ……他们本该在封锁生成的[b]抗魔力场[/b]内的。

original: Tyrion: There can only be one way that "rat" could have an [b]illusion[/b] spell active on it.
translation: Tyrion: 只有一种方法能让“老鼠”身上有生效的[b]幻象术[/b]。

original: Celeste: Wait...[p/][s/] You can't mean-!
translation: Celeste: 等等……[p/][s/]该不会是……！

original: Tyrion: That "rat" was holding the Sword of Spell Eating.
translation: Tyrion: 那只“老鼠”当时正拿着噬法之剑。

original: Celeste: What?![p/][s/] But how is that possible?!
translation: Celeste: 什么？！[p/][s/]但这怎么可能？！

original: Celeste: A rat wouldn't have the strength or hands to carry the Sword.
translation: Celeste: 一只老鼠是拿不动那把剑的。

original: Tyrion: Tracker's vocabulary is primitive and limited.[p/] He uses the word "rat" to describe small creatures that hide and act suspiciously.
translation: Tyrion: 追追的词汇量有限，用词也很基础。[p/]他会用“老鼠”来指代行为可疑且爱隐藏踪迹的小动物。

original: Celeste: But even if it wasn't an [i]actual[/i] rat,[p/][s/] it still couldn't have been a human, right?!
translation: Celeste: 但就算那不是<u>真的</u>老鼠，[p/][s/]也不可能是人类吧？！

original: Tyrion: You're right...[p/] It would have been a small animal.
translation: Tyrion: 你说得对……[p/]肯定得是某种小动物。

original: Tyrion: ...A small animal with the strength and dexterity to traverse a small air vent while holding a sword.
translation: Tyrion: ……一种力量与灵活度足够强大，可以在小型通风管道里持剑穿梭的小动物。

original: Tyrion: Sorry,[p/] but I really have to ask...[p/] Is that a monkey riding on your back?
translation: Tyrion: 如果冒犯到很抱歉，[p/]但我真的想问一下……[p/]骑在你背上的那是只猴子吗？

original: Harold: Yes.[p/] This is my familiar:[p/] Eugene.
translation: Harold: 没错，[p/]这是我的使魔：[p/]尤金。

original: Celeste: No...[p/][s/] Are you serious?!
translation: Celeste: 不会吧……[p/][s/]你是认真的？！

original: Tyrion: We know that Harold had a motive to kill William Frega.[p/] He was planning to defund the Haroldson Hall of History.
translation: Tyrion: 我们知道哈罗德有杀害威廉·弗雷加的动机。[p/]威廉正打算削减哈罗德森历史长廊的经费。

original: Tyrion: They had an argument that night.[p/] And [i]that's[/i] when William Frega decided that he was going to defund Harold's museums.
translation: Tyrion: 当晚他们有过争执。[p/]威廉·弗雷加就是在<u>那时</u>决定要对哈罗德的博物馆撤资。

original: Tyrion: He must have struck a deal with Beatrice.[p/] And with Beatrice's portion of House Frega,[p/] she could have easily kept his museums funded.
translation: Tyrion: 他一定和比亚特丽丝有什么约定。[p/]比亚特丽丝能继承部分家产，[p/]她可以继续为博物馆投资。

original: Tyrion: He could've faked the robbery and sent his familiar to murder William.
translation: Tyrion: 他可以伪造抢劫，并派遣自己的使魔谋杀威廉。

original: Celeste: I can't believe this...
translation: Celeste: 真是难以置信……

original: Tyrion: And there's something else that Tracker said.
translation: Tyrion: 追追还提到了别的事。

original: Tracker: Tracker could smell where rat was,[p/] so Tracker bork at him.
translation: Tracker: 追追闻到了老鼠在哪儿，[p/]朝它大叫。

original: Tracker: Tracker must have scared rat.[p/] Because he fell onto the floor and dropped his stick.
translation: Tracker: 追追肯定吓到老鼠了。[p/]因为它摔在了地板上，还弄掉了他的棍子。

original: Tyrion: ...The rat had a stick?
translation: Tyrion: ……那只老鼠带着棍子？

original: Tyrion: Tracker.[p/] You said you had to [i]smell[/i] to "see" where the rat was.
translation: Tyrion: 追追，[p/]你说过必须靠<u>闻</u>才能“找到”老鼠在哪里？

original: Tyrion: And when he dropped his "stick" you were finally able to see him.
translation: Tyrion: 而当他弄丢“棍子”的时候，你终于能看到他了。

original: Tyrion: Does this mean you couldn't [i]visually[/i] see him [i]before[/i] he fell down?
translation: Tyrion: 这是不是说在他摔倒<u>之前</u>你是没办法<u>亲眼</u>看到他的？

original: Tracker: Yeah.[p/] Tracker couldn't see the rat with his eyes.[p/] So Tracker used his nose to see it.
translation: Tracker: 对。[p/]追追不能用眼睛看到老鼠，[p/]所以追追用自己的鼻子找它。

original: Celeste: ...The monkey was invisible!
translation: Celeste: ……猴子隐形了！

original: Tyrion: No one would have noticed a small invisible animal.
translation: Tyrion: 没人能注意到一个隐身的小动物。

original: Tyrion: In addition to that,[p/] he moved through the air vents...
translation: Tyrion: 不只如此，[p/]他通过通风管道行动。

original: Tyrion: Eugene would have been nearly undetectable that night.
translation: Tyrion: 尤金当晚几乎不会被任何人发现。

original: Tyrion: Beatrice is a master of [b]illusion[/b] magic.[p/] So it's possible that she cast [b]invisibility[/b] on Eugene.
translation: Tyrion: 比亚特丽丝是[b]幻象术[/b]大师。[p/]尤金身上的[b]隐形术[/b]有可能是她施加的。

original: Liafal: ...
translation: Liafal: ……

original: Tyrion: And then there's the position of this air vent.
translation: Tyrion: 然后就是这个通风管道的位置。

original: Tyrion: We're currently in the hallway just north of Beatrice's room.
translation: Tyrion: 我们目前所处的走廊在比亚特丽丝房间北侧。

original: Tyrion: And this air vent connects to the ground floor.
translation: Tyrion: 这条通风管道通往一楼。

original: Tyrion: If we align the two floor maps together,[p/] this vent must lead to the storage room.
translation: Tyrion: 如果我们把两层楼的地图对齐放在一起，[p/]就能看出这条管道通向储藏室。

original: Celeste: Right.[p/] The air vent there curved upwards.[p/] This must be where it leads.
translation: Celeste: 没错。[p/]通风管道向上弯曲。[p/]一定是通向那里的。

original: Tyrion: And according to Jan,[p/] that air vent led directly to William's Study.
translation: Tyrion: 根据简的证言，[p/]通风管道直接通向威廉的书房。

original: Tyrion: It would have been the perfect route to enter William's Study and leave undetected.
translation: Tyrion: 要想进出威廉的书房且不被发现，这就是最佳路线。

original: Celeste: But he wouldn't have needed to nullify the lock to enter that room.
translation: Celeste: 但这样的话他就不需要把锁无效化了呀。

original: Celeste: Why would he need to use the Sword of Spell Eating at all?
translation: Celeste: 他为什么要用噬法之剑呢？

original: Tyrion: Because of [b]Familial Bond[/b],[p/] they can telepathically communicate with each other.
translation: Tyrion: 因为[b]使魔契约[/b]，[p/]他们能远程交流。

original: Tyrion: Harold probably needed Eugene to hold the Sword so he could tell him exactly where to go.
translation: Tyrion: 哈罗德大概率需要尤金时刻拿着剑，这样才能通过心灵感应确定路线。

original: Tyrion: The Sword's magic affects anyone magically connected to the wielder.[p/] And [b]Familial Bond[/b] connects them magically.
translation: Tyrion: 剑的魔法会影响持有者，[p/]而[b]使魔契约[/b]将尤金与哈罗德联系起来。

original: Tyrion: It makes sense now...[p/] Harold could have easily faked the robbery to take suspicion off of him.
translation: Tyrion: 这样就说得通了……[p/]哈罗德可以轻松伪造劫案，借此洗脱嫌疑。

original: Tyrion: It's even possible that he was lying about how the display glass was shattered.
translation: Tyrion: 他甚至可能在展柜玻璃为何粉碎这方面撒了谎。

original: Liafal: But I've known Lord Haroldson for many years,[p/] I just can't believe that he'd be involved in this...
translation: Liafal: 但我认识哈罗德森勋爵很多年了，[p/]我真不相信他与这件事有关……

original: She may have known Harold for a long time.[p/] But she's never read his thoughts.
translation: 她可能认识哈罗德很久了。[p/]但她可没有读心的能力。

original: His thoughts were very hostile and rude, despite his kind expression.[p/] He's very good at hiding what he's truly feeling.
translation: 虽然脸上挂着和蔼的神情，但他的真实想法粗鲁且充满敌意。[p/]他十分擅长隐藏自己的真实想法。

original: Liafal: And Beatrice...[p/] There's no way she'd participate in a plan like this.
translation: Liafal: 比亚特丽丝她……[p/]她绝不可能参与这种事情。

original: Tyrion: Look, Laefe...[p/] I know you don't want to suspect your sister,[p/] but-
translation: Tyrion: 是这样的，拉菲……[p/]我知道你不愿去怀疑你的姐姐，[p/]但——

original: Liafal: ...It's not that.
translation: Liafal: ……不是因为这个。

original: Liafal: Beatrice would never trust anyone enough to work together like this.
translation: Liafal: 比亚特丽丝永远不会相信别人，也绝对不会像这样和别人合作。

original: Tyrion: But she's completely blind.[p/] She wouldn't have much of a choice.
translation: Tyrion: 但是她完全失明了。[p/]没有太多的选择。

original: Liafal: Even so...[p/] She's not the type of person to trust her accomplice to stay quiet.
translation: Liafal: 即便如此……[p/]她也不是那种相信同伙能保持沉默的人。

original: Liafal: She'd find a way to carry out a plan herself.[p/] And she'd only employ someone else's help if she had full control of them.
translation: Liafal: 她会找到办法自己执行计划。[p/]只有在能够完全掌控别人的情况下，她才会借助别人的力量。

original: Laefe probably knows her better than you do.[p/] But you doubt that working alone would be possible with her condition.
translation: 拉菲比你更了解她。[p/]但你还是不觉得比亚特丽丝能够独自作案。

original: And you can't think of any other way she'd be involved in this.
translation: 你也想不出其他能让她参与其中的情况。

original: Liafal: Anyways,[p/] we're finished here, aren't we?
translation: Liafal: 总之，[p/]我们在这儿没什么要调查的了吧？

original: Tyrion: Yes.[p/] Thank you for lending Tracker to us, Laefe.
translation: Tyrion: 对的。[p/]拉菲，谢谢你把追追借给我们。

original: Liafal: ...I only want to help you find out what really happened.
translation: Liafal: ……我只是想帮你调查清楚到底发生了什么。

original: Liafal: Don't make me regret trusting you, Mr. Cuthbert.
translation: Liafal: 卡斯伯特先生，别辜负了我的信任。

original: Tyrion: If you're truly on the side of justice,[p/] then you won't.
translation: Tyrion: 如果你站在正义的一方，[p/]那尽管放心。

original: Liafal: Good...
translation: Liafal: 很好……

original: Liafal: Now if you'll excuse me.
translation: Liafal: 恕我失陪。

original: Celeste: So that's it, right?[p/] We finally know who really committed the murder, then.
translation: Celeste: 所以这就是真相了吗？[p/]我们总算弄清楚真凶是谁了。

original: And if you can get Harold to confess on the stand,[p/] he might reveal Beatrice's involvement as well.
translation: 如果你能让哈罗德在证人席坦白，[p/]也许还能让他顺便揭发比亚特丽丝。

original: If he does that,[p/] you might be able to convince her and Ms. Tymora to take a plea deal.
translation: 如果一切顺利，[p/]或许能说服她和泰摩拉女士接受认罪协定。

original: ...Although,[p/] knowing Ms. Tymora,[p/] that will be easier said than done.
translation: ……不过，[p/]了解泰摩拉女士的人都知道，[p/]这说起来容易做起来难。

original: Tyrion: Anyways,[p/] this is definitely the lead that we've been looking for.
translation: Tyrion: 总之，[p/]这绝对是我们在找的线索。

original: Celeste: But is it really enough?[p/] We still don't have any physical evidence.
translation: Celeste: 但证据真的足够吗？[p/]我们还没有任何实质性的证据。

original: Tyrion: It'll have to do for now.[p/] We're running out of time.
translation: Tyrion: 现在只能暂且如此了。[p/]我们已经没什么时间了。

original: Tyrion: We'll just have to call Harold to the stand to testify about what he did that night.
translation: Tyrion: 我们只需要把哈罗德请到证人席，让他就当晚的事作证就可以了。

original: Tyrion: If I can push him far enough,[p/] I might be able to catch him lying.
translation: Tyrion: 如果我能把他逼到绝境，[p/]或许能戳破他的谎言。

original: But you doubt it will be that easy.[p/] He has a good poker face.
translation: 但估计不会那么简单，[p/]他很会摆一张扑克脸。

original: Just how much will he be able to hide his true thoughts?
translation: 他还能继续掩盖真实想法多久呢？

original: Harold: I already gave my statement to the Inquisition.[p/] Is my testimony really necessary?
translation: Harold: 我已经向裁判所陈述了我的所见所闻。[p/]还有必要让我出庭作证吗？

original: Orym: Sorry, old-timer.[p/] My orders come [i]straight[/i] from the prosecutor.
translation: Orym: 抱歉，老前辈。[p/]我<u>直接</u>听令于检察官。

original: Orym: We're going to need you on the stand today.
translation: Orym: 今天我们需要你出庭作证。

original: Harold: Hm...[p/] I understand.[p/] I'll do what I can to help.
translation: Harold: 嗯……[p/]我明白了。[p/]我会尽我所能。

original: They even have gold-tinted chandeliers in the hallways...
translation: 走廊里甚至还有金色的吊灯……

original: It's ridiculous when you really think about it.
translation: 这贫富差距怪吓人的。

original: There are several jewels mounted on the wall.[p/] And they all look equidistant from each other.
translation: 墙上镶着一些珠宝。[p/]而且似乎是等距摆放的。

original: You already knew that House Frega is wealthy.[p/] But embedding jewels into the walls makes the place look pretty tacky.
translation: 你早听说弗雷加家十分富有。[p/]但在墙上镶嵌珠宝实在是十分俗气。

original: Tyrion: Hm...[p/] This place looks pretty quiet.[p/] But there aren't any tables anywhere.
translation: Tyrion: 嗯……[p/]这里非常安静。[p/]但没有任何桌子。

original: Tyrion: ...Well,[p/] I [i]could[/i] play on the floor...
translation: Tyrion: ……好吧，[p/]我在地上也<u>能</u>下棋……

original: Tyrion: W-[p/][s/]What the-?!
translation: Tyrion: 什、[p/][s/]什么——？！

original: While walking through the hallways,[p/][s/] you suddenly find yourself face to face with a large wolf!
translation: 穿过走廊时，[p/][s/]你突然发现自己与一头身形巨大的狼面对面。

original: Immediately upon seeing you,[p/] the wolf quickly gallops away.
translation: 一看见你，[p/]这头狼立刻跑掉了。

original: Tyrion: ...Did someone leave a door open?
translation: Tyrion: ……是谁忘记关门了吗？

original: You think about telling someone...[p/] But you remember that the manor is full of nobles.
translation: 你想着要把这事告诉别人……[p/]但你想起整个庄园内都是贵族。

original: You're sure a servant will spot it eventually.[p/] And it's not as if anyone will believe you anyways.
translation: 你很确定总会有仆从发现它的。[p/]反正就算说了也没人会相信你。

original: ...But it'd be probably best to find somewhere else to play.
translation: ……不过最好找别的地方下棋。

original: Up until now,[p/] we've been following the story of Tyrion Cuthbert.
translation: 直到目前，[p/]我们一直在关注提利昂·卡斯伯特的故事。

original: We've experienced the world through his Eyes.[p/] And fought for justice through his soul.
translation: 我们通过他的“眼睛”体验这个世界，[p/]通过他的灵魂为正义而战。

original: ...But this time,[p/] why don't we start from the perspective of another?
translation: ……但这一次，[p/]我们为何不从另一个人的视角开始呢？

original: Ruby: (I can't believe Cuthbert read the client's mind without asking...)
translation: Ruby: （我还是难以相信卡斯伯特不用提问就能阅读委托人的想法……）

original: Ruby: (It's starting to become a problem.[p/] He's becoming more and more reckless with each passing year.)
translation: Ruby: （这已经开始变成问题了。[p/]他只会变得越来越鲁莽。）

original: Ruby: (...I wish Frey was still alive.[p/] She would know what to do.)
translation: Ruby: (……我真希望芙雷还活着。[p/]她会知道该怎么处理的。)

original: Ruby: (She made it look so effortless.[p/] And he loved her.)
translation: Ruby: （她行使这个能力十分轻松。[p/]也被自己的儿子卡斯伯特深爱着。）

original: Ruby: (...Would he have listened to her if she was still here?)
translation: Ruby: (……如果她还活着，卡斯伯特会听她的话吗？)

original: Beatrice: ...Is something the matter, Tymora?
translation: Beatrice: ……有什么问题吗，泰摩拉？

original: Ruby: No...[p/] I was just thinking about something.
translation: Ruby: 没有……[p/]我只是在想事情。

original: Beatrice: Well...[p/] The trial is about to begin.
translation: Beatrice: 好吧……[p/]庭审就要开始了。

original: Beatrice: I don't doubt your abilities.[p/] But I'd still appreciate it if you remained focused.
translation: Beatrice: 我不怀疑你的水平。[p/]但我还是希望你保持专注。

original: Beatrice: [i]All[/i] of our futures are at stake, after all.
translation: Beatrice: 毕竟，我们<u>所有人</u>的未来都赌在这里了。

original: Ruby: Of course, Ms. Frega...
translation: Ruby: 那当然了，弗雷加女士……

original: Beatrice takes in a deep breath before she claps her hands together.
translation: 比亚特丽丝做了一个深呼吸，然后拍了一下手。

original: Ruby: ...What's wrong?
translation: Ruby: ……有问题吗？

original: Beatrice: ...Nothing.[p/] It's just the "ritual" that I use to calm myself.
translation: Beatrice: ……并没有。[p/]这只是我让自己冷静下来的一个“仪式”。

original: Ruby: ...Right.[p/] I'd almost forgotten about that.
translation: Ruby: ……好吧。[p/]我差点不记得有这么回事了。

original: Ruby: But more importantly...
translation: Ruby: 但更重要的是……

original: Ruby: What are [s/][i]you[/i] doing here?
translation: Ruby: [s]<u>你</u>又在这里做什么？

original: Eris: My father sent me to guide Beatrice through the courthouse.
translation: Eris: 父亲派我庭审期间担任比亚特丽丝的向导。

original: Eris: It's a new environment for her.[p/] And we were both worried about her condition.
translation: Eris: 对她来说这里是新环境。[p/]我们也都担心她的状况。

original: Ruby: I still can't believe [i]you[/i] were the boss's daughter this entire time.
translation: Ruby: 我还是难以相信<u>你</u>竟然是头目的女儿。

original: Ruby: Why didn't you say anything at the academy?
translation: Ruby: 在学院的时候你怎么都没透露这一点？

original: Eris: Oh?[p/] Knowing my true identity would have caused friction with your son, wouldn't it?
translation: Eris: 哦？[p/]知道我的真实身份的话，你与你儿子之间不会产生摩擦吗？

original: Ruby: He's not my-...
translation: Ruby: 他才不是我的——

original: Ruby: ...Anyways,[p/] I suppose I understand why you stayed quiet.
translation: Ruby: ……总之，[p/]我大概明白你为什么不说了。

original: Ruby: But I still don't appreciate being kept in the dark about this.
translation: Ruby: 但我也不会因你的隐瞒而感谢你。

original: Eris: Oh...[p/] Speak of the devil.
translation: Eris: 哇哦……[p/]真巧啊。

original: You spot Cuthbert and McCoy walking into the courtroom with the other members of the gallery.
translation: 你看到卡斯伯特和麦考伊随人流走进法庭。

original: McCoy spots you and gives a friendly,[p/] yet awkward smile.
translation: 麦考伊看到了你，并且给了你一个友好，[p/]但是尴尬的微笑。

original: ...However,[p/] Cuthbert ignores you entirely and walks silently into the courtroom.
translation: ……然而，[p/]卡斯伯特完全无视了你，一言不发地走进了法庭。

original: Eris: ...Parental troubles?
translation: Eris: ……亲子矛盾吗？

original: Ruby: ...We had an argument earlier.[p/] It's nothing to worry about.
translation: Ruby: ……我们早些时候吵了一架。[p/]没什么好担心的。

original: Eris: If you say so.
translation: Eris: 你说是就是吧。

original: You [i]are[/i] wary about what he saw in Beatrice's mind, though.
translation: 但你对他在比亚特丽丝的想法里读到了什么很<u>警惕</u>。

original: He's always been a good kid...[p/] But his idealistic sense of justice clouds his judgment sometimes.
translation: 他一直是个好孩子……[p/]但过于强烈的正义感有时候会模糊他的判断力。

original: You just hope that he's not planning to do anything reckless.
translation: 你只能希望他没有计划做什么鲁莽的事情。

original: Aria: The trial is about to begin.[p/] Do you really have the time to be making small talk here?
translation: Aria: 庭审就要开始了。[p/]你真的还有时间在这里闲聊吗？

original: Prosecutor Steelwind approaches the three of you.
translation: 斯蒂尔文德检察官向你们三个走来。

original: ...But she appears to be accompanied by someone else.
translation: ……但看起来她也有人陪伴。

original: Ruby: ...Nightgrave?[p/] Is that you?
translation: Ruby: ……奈特格雷夫？[p/]是你呀？

original: Ruby: What are you doing here?
translation: Ruby: 你在这里做什么？

original: Wallace: U-[p/][s/]Um...[p/]W-[p/][s/]Well...
translation: Wallace: 啊、[p/][s/]呃……[p/]这、[p/][s/]这个……

original: Aria: ...He's accompanying me as my aide for this case.
translation: Aria: ……他作为我的助手出庭。

original: Ruby: I see...[p/] So I assume you'll be prosecuting?
translation: Ruby: 我明白了……[p/]所以是你担任检察官？

original: Aria: Of course.[p/] I would never pass up the opportunity to face the "infamous" Ruby Tymora.
translation: Aria: 当然。[p/]我不会放过与臭名昭著的鲁比·泰摩拉对阵的机会。

original: Ruby: Really?[p/] If I recall correctly,[p/] you haven't even beaten Tyrion [i]once[/i] so far.
translation: Ruby: 真的呀？[p/]我没记错的话，[p/]你到现在甚至<u>一次</u>都没击败过提利昂。

original: Aria: ...
translation: Aria: ……

original: Wallace: La-[p/][s/] [i]Ms.[/i] Steelwind,[p/] don't strain yourself.
translation: Wallace: 斯蒂尔文德小……[p/][s/]<u>女士</u>，[p/]不要太勉强自己。

original: Beatrice: ...
translation: Beatrice: ……

original: Aria: What's that look for, Beatrice?
translation: Aria: 你那表情是什么意思，比亚特丽丝？

original: Aria: You almost look [i]surprised[/i] to see me here...
translation: Aria: 看到我在这里你好像有点<u>惊讶</u>啊……

original: Beatrice: ...Considering the circumstances,[p/] I thought you might recuse yourself.
translation: Beatrice: ……考虑到现状，[p/]我以为你会回避这次庭审。

original: Aria: I am more than capable of being objective.
translation: Aria: 我完全有能力保证客观立场。

original: Aria: ...Especially for a case of this much importance.
translation: Aria: ……特别是在这么重要的案件上。

original: Beatrice: Well...[p/] I hope your mind is as strong as you think it is.
translation: Beatrice: 那好吧……[p/]我希望你的意志如你所想的那么坚强。

original: Aria: ...
translation: Aria: ……

original: Wallace: Ms. Steelwind![p/][s/] Please calm down!
translation: Wallace: 斯蒂尔文德女士！[p/][s/]请你冷静下来！

original: Eris: Oh,[p/] how I [i]love[/i] a good reunion.
translation: Eris: 哎呀，[p/]我可太<u>爱</u>这美好的团聚了。

original: Ruby: *sigh*
translation: Ruby: *叹气*

original: Celeste: Agh!
translation: Celeste: 啊！

original: Tyrion: What's wrong?
translation: Tyrion: 怎么了？

original: Celeste: You can't see it.[p/] But the entire room is covered in traces of [b]abjuration[/b] magic.
translation: Celeste: 你看不到。[p/]但是整个房间里遍布着[b]防护术[/b]魔法的痕迹。

original: Celeste: [i]Everything[/i] is glowing white.
translation: Celeste: <u>一切</u>都闪着白光。

original: Tyrion: Right...[p/] That makes sense.[p/] There were several [i]Anti-Magic Fields[/i] covering the manor.
translation: Tyrion: 对……[p/]这就说得通了。[p/]庄园被几个<u>抗魔力场</u>覆盖着。

original: Tyrion: Those fields probably left traces of [b]abjuration[/b] everywhere.
translation: Tyrion: 可能就是这些力场在各处留下了[b]防护术[/b]魔法的痕迹。

original: Celeste: I won't bother showing you the traces of [b]abjuration[/b] I find while we're here.
translation: Celeste: 我就不费劲向你展示我在这里发现的[b]防护术[/b]痕迹了。

original: Tyrion: It's an air vent that leads into Lord Frega's Study.
translation: Tyrion: 通向弗雷加勋爵书房的通风管道。

original: Tyrion: Supposedly,[p/] Jan heard the altercation between Lord Frega and his assailant through this.
translation: Tyrion: 简应该就是通过这里听到了弗雷加勋爵和袭击者的争斗声。

original: Tyrion: It's a step ladder.
translation: Tyrion: 一个人字梯。

original: Celeste: I agree.
translation: Celeste: 我同意。

original: Tyrion: There are several boxes in this room.
translation: Tyrion: 房间里有几个箱子。

original: Tyrion: They appear to contain various cleaning supplies.
translation: Tyrion: 里面看起来装着一些清洁器材。

original: Celeste: So you're working as a servant now?
translation: Celeste: 所以你现在在当仆人？

original: Jan: Not exactly.[p/] But I was a part of the catering staff.
translation: Jan: 不太准确。[p/]我是餐饮员工之一。

original: Jan: The twins started their own food business after Frega threw us out of the academy.
translation: Jan: 弗雷加家族把我们逐出学院之后，那对双胞胎决定在餐饮方面创业。

original: Tyrion: R-[p/][s/]Right...[p/] Sorry about that...
translation: Tyrion: 这、[p/][s/]这样啊……[p/]我很遗憾……

original: Jan: Nah...[p/] It's not your fault.
translation: Jan: 不用啊……[p/]那不是你的错。

original: Jan: Even if Redmond was still headmaster,[p/] I'm sure the board would've found some other way to get rid of us.
translation: Jan: 就算雷德蒙还是校长，[p/]董事会肯定也会找到其他方法开除我们。

original: Celeste: Wait,[p/] are Valentina and Valerie here too?
translation: Celeste: 等等，[p/]瓦伦蒂娜和瓦莱丽也在这儿吗？

original: Jan: No.[p/] They just contracted some staff to Lord Frega for the Lords' Ball.
translation: Jan: 没有。[p/]她们只是为这次舞会提供了临时工。

original: Jan: I think a bunch of other businesses did the same thing.
translation: Jan: 做类似生意的人还有很多。

original: You wonder how they feel about this.
translation: 你很好奇她们怎么看待这件事。

original: They lent their services to the very man who got them fired in the first place.
translation: 她们在为最初导致自己失业的人提供服务。

original: William must have offered them a lot of gold.
translation: 威廉肯定也支付了她们不少钱吧。

original: Jan: Man,[p/] I can't believe I got myself pulled into [i]another[/i] murder investigation.
translation: Jan: 唉，[p/]我真的不敢相信自己又被卷入<u>另一起</u>凶杀案。

original: Jan: Do I have bad luck or what?
translation: Jan: 我是厄运缠身还是怎么着？

original: Tyrion: The prosecutor told us that you heard the altercation through the air vents.
translation: Tyrion: 检察官告诉我们，你通过通风管听到了争斗声。

original: Tyrion: Could you tell us exactly what you heard?
translation: Tyrion: 你能告诉我们具体听到了什么吗？

original: Jan: Well,[p/] I didn't hear everything.[p/] I was taking a nap in this room when it happened.
translation: Jan: 好吧。[p/]我没有听到全程。[p/]当时我正在这个房间里小睡。

original: Celeste: Why [i]were[/i] you napping here?
translation: Celeste: 你<u>为什么</u>在这里睡觉啊？

original: Jan: I didn't have a choice.[p/] I accidentally closed the door when the lock was engaged.
translation: Jan: 我又没得选。[p/]我不小心在上锁的时候把门关上了。

original: Jan: Before I knew it,[p/] I was trapped here.
translation: Jan: 反应过来之前，[p/]我就被困在这里了。

original: Right...[p/] You recall Steelwind mentioning that.
translation: 没错……[p/]你想起来斯蒂尔文德提过这一点。

original: Jan: Anyways,[p/] I heard the sound of some kind of struggle going on.
translation: Jan: 总之，[p/]我好像听到有人在挣扎的声音。

original: Jan: I couldn't hear everything but I heard Lord Frega shout,[p/][s/] "Who are you?![p/][s/] What do you want?!".
translation: Jan: 虽然听得没有很清楚，但我听到弗雷加勋爵叫了一声，[p/][s/]“你是谁？！[p/][s/]你想要什么？！”。

original: Jan: That went on for a few seconds.[p/] Then I heard the sound of someone getting stabbed.
translation: Jan: 这持续了几秒钟。[p/]然后我听到好像有人被刺中了。

original: Tyrion: Did you hear the voice of the assailant?
translation: Tyrion: 你有听到袭击者的声音吗？

original: Jan: They didn't say anything but I [i]did[/i] hear them.
translation: Jan: 他们没有说话，但我<u>确实</u>听到了他们的动静。

original: Jan: Their voice was really raspy.[p/] I think they had a sore throat or something.
translation: Jan: 他们的声音真的好刺耳。[p/]我想他们是嗓子不舒服吧。

original: Or they were trying to mask their voice...
translation: 或者他们是在掩盖自己的真实声线……

original: Tyrion: Why did you enter the storage room anyways?
translation: Tyrion: 总之，你为什么要进来这个储藏室？

original: Jan: The servants were complaining about rats running through the air vents.[p/] So they sent me to take care of it.
translation: Jan: 佣人们抱怨老鼠在通风管道里跑来跑去。[p/]所以他们让我去处理一下。

original: Jan: I heard one of them running in the vents upstairs.[p/] And I followed it here.
translation: Jan: 我听到其中一只在楼上的通风管道里跑。[p/]然后就跟着它来到了这里。

original: Jan: I figured it had nowhere else to go.[p/] So I opened it up and put a trap down.
translation: Jan: 我想它无路可走了。[p/]所以我打开了通风管道并设置了一个陷阱。

original: Jan: After I was done,[p/] I tried to leave but the door was locked.
translation: Jan: 做完以后我就想离开，[p/]但是门锁上了。

original: Jan: I didn't have anything else to do.[p/] So I took a nap.
translation: Jan: 我没事情可做了。[p/]所以我就小睡一下。

original: Jan: Man...[p/] I never thought I'd see [i]you[/i] two again.
translation: Jan: 哎……[p/]我没想过还能再见到<u>你们两个</u>。

original: Jan: Trouble seems to follow you wherever you go.
translation: Jan: 你们到哪里麻烦就跟到哪里。

original: Celeste: I think it's more that [i]we[/i] tend to follow trouble wherever [i]it[/i] appears.
translation: Celeste: 我倒是觉得麻烦跑到<u>哪里</u>我们就追到<u>哪里</u>。

original: Celeste: So you're working as a caterer now?
translation: Celeste: 所以你现在改行做供餐员了？

original: Jan: Not directly.[p/] But I'm on their cleaning staff.
translation: Jan: 不太准确。[p/]但我是这里的清洁人员。

original: Jan: The twins started their own food business after Frega threw us out of the academy.
translation: Jan: 弗雷加家族把我们逐出学院之后，那对双胞胎决定在餐饮方面创业。

original: Tyrion: R-[p/][s/]Right...[p/] Sorry about that...
translation: Tyrion: 这、[p/][s/]这样啊……[p/]我很遗憾……

original: Jan: Nah...[p/] It's not your fault.
translation: Jan: 不用啊……[p/]那不是你的错。

original: Jan: Even if Redmond was still the headmaster,[p/] the board would have found some other way to get rid of us.
translation: Jan: 就算雷德蒙还是校长，[p/]董事会肯定也会找到其他方法开除我们。

original: Celeste: Wait, so Valentina and Valerie are here too?
translation: Celeste: 等等，[p/]那瓦伦蒂娜和瓦莱丽也在这儿吗？

original: Jan: Not at the moment.[p/] They just lent some staff to Lord Frega for the Lords' Ball.
translation: Jan: 这会儿没有。[p/]她们只是为这次舞会提供了临时工。

original: Jan: I think a bunch of other companies are doing the same thing.
translation: Jan: 做类似生意的人还有很多。

original: You wonder how they feel about this.
translation: 你很好奇她们怎么看待这件事。

original: They lent their services to the very man who got them fired in the first place.
translation: 她们在为最初导致自己失业的人提供服务。

original: Lord Frega must have offered them a lot of gold.
translation: 弗雷加勋爵肯定也支付了她们不少钱吧。

original: Tyrion: It's strange that they had you chasing rats in the vents.
translation: Tyrion: 他们派你来抓通风管道里的老鼠有点奇怪啊。

original: Tyrion: I'd expect the manor servants to take care of that.
translation: Tyrion: 我以为处理这些事情的应该是庄园的人。

original: Jan: They've tried,[p/] but they haven't had much luck.
translation: Jan: 他们已经试过了，[p/]但运气不太好。

original: Jan: I don't know what's up with them.[p/] These rats have avoided all of the traps they've set.
translation: Jan: 我不知道怎么回事，[p/]但那些老鼠避开了他们设下的所有陷阱。

original: Tyrion: What can you tell me about this, Mr. Hughes?
translation: Tyrion: 关于这个你有什么想法吗，休斯先生？

original: Jan: ...
translation: Jan: ……

original: Tyrion: ...Mr. Hughes?
translation: Tyrion: ……休斯先生？

original: Jan: ...
translation: Jan: ……

original: ...It doesn't look like that's evoking much of a response from him.
translation: ……看起来他没什么想法。

original: You enter the storage room,[p/] hoping to investigate the air vent that connects to Lord Frega's Study.
translation: 你进入储藏室，[p/]希望调查与弗雷加勋爵书房相连的那段通风管道。

original: ...When you come across a person laying on the floor.
translation: ……但你碰到了一个躺在地上的人。

original: Celeste: W-[p/][s/]What...?
translation: Celeste: 这、[p/][s/]这是……？

original: Celeste: Jan?![p/][s/] Is that you?!
translation: Celeste: 简？！[p/][s/]是你吗？！

original: Jan: Aw, man...[p/] What's with all the noise?
translation: Jan: 唉，天啊……[p/]怎么这么吵？

original: Jan: I was having such a good nap too.
translation: Jan: 我难得睡个好觉。

original: Tyrion: Mr. Hughes.
translation: Tyrion: 休斯先生。

original: Jan: Whoa...[p/] It's you two.
translation: Jan: 哇哦……[p/]是你们两个啊。

original: Celeste: Why are you taking a nap in the storage room?
translation: Celeste: 你为什么在储藏室里睡觉啊？

original: Jan: I needed to take a break from all the chaos going on.[p/] The Kingsguard won't let us leave until they finish investigating the murder.
translation: Jan: 我想在这一片混乱中休息一下。[p/]国王卫队在完成凶杀案的调查前不会让我们离开的。

original: Jan: And this pompous noble shooed me away when I tried sleeping on one of the couches.
translation: Jan: 而一个傲慢的贵族在我想睡在沙发上时把我赶走了。

original: Jan: I didn't expect anyone to find me here.
translation: Jan: 我没想到有人能找到这里来。

original: Tyrion: Anyways,[p/] the prosecutor told us that you heard the murder from here during the lockdown.
translation: Tyrion: 总之，[p/]检察官告诉我们，封锁期间你在这里听到了凶杀发生的情况。

original: Tyrion: Do you think you could tell us what happened?
translation: Tyrion: 你能跟我们说说当时发生了什么吗？

original: Jan: Sure.[p/] Why not?
translation: Jan: 好啊。[p/]为什么不呢？

original: Jan: My nap's kind of ruined anyways.
translation: Jan: 反正我也睡不成了。

original: He only heard a few words before the murderer struck the final blow.
translation: 凶手发动最后一击之前，他也只听到了几个字。

original: It doesn't give you much to go on...[p/] But his testimony could become relevant later.
translation: 没什么新进展……[p/]但他的证词之后可能会有意义。

original: For now,[p/] you should probably MOVE somewhere else and gather more information.
translation: 目前，你应该 <size=1.5em>移动</size> 到别处获取更多信息。

original: Celeste: Agh!
translation: Celeste: 啊！

original: Tyrion: What's wrong?
translation: Tyrion: 怎么了？

original: Celeste: You can't see it.[p/] But the entire room is covered in traces of [b]abjuration[/b] magic.
translation: Celeste: 你看不到。[p/]但是整个房间里遍布着[b]防护术[/b]魔法的痕迹。

original: Celeste: [i]Everything[/i] is glowing white.
translation: Celeste: <u>一切</u>都闪着白光。

original: Tyrion: Right...[p/] That makes sense.[p/] There were several [i]Anti-Magic Fields[/i] covering the manor.
translation: Tyrion: 对……[p/]这就说得通了。[p/]庄园被几个<u>抗魔力场</u>覆盖着。

original: Tyrion: Those fields probably left traces of [b]abjuration[/b] everywhere.
translation: Tyrion: 可能就是这些力场在各处留下了[b]防护术[/b]魔法的痕迹。

original: Celeste: I won't bother showing you the traces of [b]abjuration[/b] I find while we're here.
translation: Celeste: 我就不费劲向你展示我在这里发现的[b]防护术[/b]痕迹了。

original: Tyrion: Big surprise...[p/] Another chandelier.
translation: Tyrion: 大惊喜……[p/]又是一盏吊灯。

original: Celeste: This room probably costs more than my family's tavern.
translation: Celeste: 这房间的内设估计比我家酒馆都贵。

original: Tyrion: It's a fireplace...[p/] Could the murderer have entered through here?
translation: Tyrion: 一个壁炉……[p/]凶手有可能从这儿进入书房吗？

original: Aria: That wouldn't be possible.[p/] The chimney is far too narrow.
translation: Aria: 不可能，[p/]烟囱太窄了。

original: Aria: Even a small child wouldn't be thin enough to fit through it.
translation: Aria: 即使小孩也没办法通过。

original: Tyrion: It's a painting of some sort of scholar.[p/] There's some text on it.
translation: Tyrion: 一幅学者的画像。有几行字。

original: Tyrion: "Rook Resingar:[p/] economic scholar and aristocratic accountant."
translation: Tyrion: “Rook Resingar：[p/]经济学者以及贵族会计。”

original: Tyrion: "He was known in some circles as "Rook the cook",[p/] due to his ability to "cook the books" of the Four Pillar Houses."
translation: Tyrion: “他在某些圈子里被称作厨子 Rook，因为他有“料理”四大家族账单的能力。”

original: Celeste: "Rook the cook"...
translation: Celeste: “厨子 Rook”……

original: Celeste: Sometimes I wish I could have a nickname like that.
translation: Celeste: 我有时候也想获得这种称号。

original: Tyrion: What about "Crimson Demon"?
translation: Tyrion: “绯红恶魔”怎么样？

original: Celeste: Ugh...[p/] Not that one.
translation: Celeste: 呃啊……[p/]别提那个了。

original: Tyrion: It's a bookshelf filled with books.
translation: Tyrion: 摆满书的书架。

original: Celeste: I wonder what kind of books Lord Frega owned.
translation: Celeste: 我蛮好奇弗雷加勋爵会放什么样的书。

original: Celeste: Wait a minute...[p/][s/] They're all blank!
translation: Celeste: 等下……[p/][s/]这些书都是空白的！

original: Tyrion: All of his real books are on the floor or his desk.
translation: Tyrion: 所有真书都在地板或者他桌子上。

original: Tyrion: There's a window that leads into this room...
translation: Tyrion: 有扇通向这房间的窗户……

original: Tyrion: Could the murderer have escaped through here?
translation: Tyrion: 凶手有可能是从这儿逃离书房的吗？

original: Aria: No.[p/] The window doesn't open and the glass is magically reinforced.
translation: Aria: 没可能。[p/]窗户无法打开，而且玻璃是被魔法加固过的。

original: Tyrion: There are several books about economics and politics.
translation: Tyrion: 有几本关于经济和政治的书。

original: Tyrion: It doesn't look like there's anything of note.
translation: Tyrion: 看起来没什么值得注意的。

original: Tyrion: There's a pool of blood and a chalk outline where the body must have been.
translation: Tyrion: 这里有一滩血泊，还有粉笔画出的尸体轮廓。

original: Tyrion: There's a large mahogany table at the end of the room.
translation: Tyrion: 房间尽头摆放着一张大型桃花心木桌子。

original: Tyrion: Lord Frega must have done his work here.
translation: Tyrion: 弗雷加勋爵就是在这处理公事的。

original: Celeste: There's a trace of [b]illusion[/b] magic where the body was.
translation: Celeste: 尸体的位置上有[b]幻象术[/b]魔法的痕迹。

original: Tyrion: Hm...[p/] The assailant must have used some kind of magical disguise.
translation: Tyrion: 嗯……[p/]凶手一定用了某种魔法伪装。

original: Celeste: Or they turned themselves invisible.
translation: Celeste: 或者隐身了。

original: Tyrion: What can you tell me about the murder?
translation: Tyrion: 请问能讲讲这起谋杀案的细节吗？

original: Aria: William Frega was found dead in this room after the lockdown was lifted.
translation: Aria: 封锁结束后，威廉·弗雷加的尸体在这个房间被发现。

original: Wait...[p/] "lockdown"?![p/][s/] What lockdown?!
Aria: From what we can tell,[p/] his throat had been slashed open with a letter opener.
translation: Aria: 从目前的情况来看，[p/]被害人的喉咙被一把拆信刀割开。

original: Wallace: The cause of death was blood loss.[p/] Both of his carotid arteries were severed.
translation: Wallace: 死因是失血过多。[p/]死者两条颈动脉均被割裂。

original: Aria: Here's the Autopsy Report if you want a detailed description.
translation: Aria: 这是尸检报告，上面的记录更详细。

original: Tyrion: Were you able to find the murder weapon?
translation: Tyrion: 你有找到凶器吗？

original: Aria: Yes.[p/] The murderer left it at the crime scene.[p/] It was a letter opener owned by the victim.
translation: Aria: 找到了。[p/]凶手就把它留在了犯罪现场。[p/]是把受害者的拆信刀。

original: Tyrion: Hm...[p/] The murderer must have found it in this room and used it...
translation: Tyrion: 嗯……[p/]凶手一定是在房间里就地取材……

original: Aria: There [i]was[/i] one strange detail about the weapon.
translation: Aria: 关于武器<u>有</u>个很怪的细节。

original: Aria: The handle was completely shattered.
translation: Aria: 刀柄完全碎裂了。

original: Aria: We're not sure what to make of that detail.[p/] But it's as if something crushed the handle using tremendous force.
translation: Aria: 我们不太明白这意味着什么。[p/]但刀柄看起来是被庞大的力量粉碎。

original: What could have caused the handle to shatter like that?
translation: 是什么能让刀柄碎成这样呢？

original: Tyrion: You mentioned that there was a lockdown.[p/] When did this happen?
translation: Tyrion: 你刚刚提到封锁。[p/]那是什么时候的事？

original: Aria: You didn't notice?[p/] The Inquisition [i]did[/i] try to be discreet.
translation: Aria: 你没注意到吗？[p/]裁判所这次<u>确实</u>做到了隐蔽行事。

original: Aria: But everyone noticed the commotion Beatrice and the two princes made over it.
translation: Aria: 但比亚特丽丝和两位王子那边的骚动却是人尽皆知。

original: Aria: ...I suppose you two must have been lost in your own little world, weren't you?
translation: Aria: ……看来你们两个是沉迷于二人世界了？
……啊哦。

original: Tyrion: W-[p/][s/]Well anyways,[p/] you said that Lord Frega's body was found [i]after[/i] the lockdown.
translation: Tyrion: 总、[p/][s/]总之，[p/]你说弗雷加勋爵的尸体是在封锁<u>结束后</u>才被发现的。

original: Tyrion: That means that something else must have happened prior.
translation: Tyrion: 意味着在这之前肯定发生了别的事。

original: Aria: Supposedly,[p/] someone had broken into one of the Haroldson exhibits.
translation: Aria: 据说，[p/]有人闯进了哈罗德森的展览室之一。

original: Aria: One of the magical artifacts was stolen.
translation: Aria: 魔法遗物之一失窃了。

original: Tyrion: So there was also a theft last night...
translation: Tyrion: 原来昨晚还有个窃案……

original: Tyrion: Does the manor's lockdown system behave like the one at the Imperial Academy?
translation: Tyrion: 庄园的封锁系统和帝国学院的类似吗？

original: Aria: The systems are somewhat different.
translation: Aria: 两者有些许不同。

original: Aria: Unlike the Imperial Academy,[p/] the lockdown only prevents people from leaving or entering the manor.
translation: Aria: 不同于帝国学院，[p/]庄园的封锁系统只会阻止人们进出庄园。

original: Tyrion: So not [i]all[/i] of the rooms were locked.[p/] But what about this specific room?
translation: Tyrion: 所以并非<u>所有</u>房间都上锁了。[p/]但这个房间呢？

original: Aria: [i]This[/i] room does have abjuration wards that lock the door and prevent teleportation in and out of it.
translation: Aria: <u>这个</u>房间有防护术结界，传送魔法也无法使用。

original: Aria: And in addition to that,[p/] the system placed an [b]Anti-Magic Field[/b] over the manor.
translation: Aria: 不仅如此，[p/]封锁系统会在庄园范围内设置[b]抗魔力场[/b]。

original: Celeste: An [b]Anti-Magic Field[/b]?!
translation: Celeste: 一个[b]抗魔力场[/b]？！

original: Tyrion: What is that?
translation: Tyrion: 那是什么？

original: Celeste: [b]Anti-Magic Field[/b] is a spell that nullifies all magic within it.
translation: Celeste: [b]抗魔力场[/b]是种能够将范围内的所有魔法无效化的法术。

original: Tyrion: And the system somehow covered the entire manor in this effect...
translation: Tyrion: 封锁系统能使整个庄园都处于这种效果下……

original: Aria: If you noticed,[p/] there are several purple crystals embedded in the walls of the manor.
translation: Aria: 如果你细心观察，[p/]庄园的墙上镶嵌着一些紫色水晶。

original: Aria: Each of those crystals produced an [b]Anti-Magic Field[/b] during the lockdown.
translation: Aria: 在封锁时，每个水晶都会生成一个[b]抗魔力场[/b]。

original: Tyrion: So no one could cast magic during the entirety of the lockdown?
translation: Tyrion: 所以说在整个封锁过程中没有人能施法咯？

original: Aria: Not exactly...[p/] Someone could have used the stolen artifact to circumvent it.
translation: Aria: 也不是……[p/]可以用失窃的遗物来规避这个效果。

original: Tyrion: You mentioned that someone could have used the stolen artifact to get past the [b]Anti-Magic Fields[/b].
translation: Tyrion: 你提到失窃的遗物可以被用来规避[b]抗魔力场[/b]的效果。

original: Tyrion: Which artifact was it?
translation: Tyrion: 那是什么遗物？

original: Aria: It was the Sword of Spell Eating.
translation: Aria: 是噬法之剑。

original: That was the demon-forged item that could supposedly nullify magic...
translation: 一件由恶魔锻造，据传能使魔法无效化的遗物……

original: If the legends were true,[p/] someone could've used it to counteract the lockdown system.
translation: 如果传说不假，[p/]就可以用它来抵消封锁系统的效果。

original: Aria: After Lord Haroldson reported the theft,[p/] the Inquisition discreetly placed the manor on lockdown.
translation: Aria: 哈罗德森勋爵通报失窃一事后，[p/]裁判所慎重地封锁了庄园。

original: Aria: They searched every room in the manor to try to find it.
translation: Aria: 为寻找剑，他们搜查了庄园所有房间。

original: Aria: But it was eventually found in Beatrice's bedroom.
translation: Aria: 最终剑在比亚特丽丝的卧室被发现。

original: Tyrion: ...And that led them to believe that [i]she[/i] had stolen it.
translation: Tyrion: ……所以他们认为是<u>她</u>偷了剑。

original: Aria: That's correct.[p/] The Kingsguard moved to arrest her,[p/] but Prince Aster ordered them to step down.
translation: Aria: 是的。[p/]国王卫队准备逮捕她，[p/]但阿斯特王子阻止了他们。

original: Aria: It didn't look like she was planning on fleeing.[p/] So they planned to wait until after the party had ended.
translation: Aria: 当时她看起来不像是要逃跑的样子。[p/]所以裁判所打算等到舞会结束后再逮捕她。

original: Tyrion: ...But then they found Lord Frega's body.
translation: Tyrion: ……但他们随后发现了弗雷加勋爵的尸体。

original: Aria: Correct.[p/] We believe that she used the stolen sword to nullify the magical locks and break into Lord Frega's study.
translation: Aria: 没错。[p/]我们认为她用那把失窃的剑解除了附魔锁，闯入弗雷加勋爵的书房。

original: Celeste: But if she had the Sword,[p/] why wouldn't she use [i]that[/i] to commit the murder?
translation: Celeste: 但如果她拿着那把剑，[p/]为什么要用<u>拆信刀</u>杀人呢？

original: Aria: We're not entirely sure.[p/] We have a few working theories.
translation: Aria: 我们也不太明白。[p/]目前有几个初步推论。

original: Aria: She might have wanted to prevent the theft from being tied to the murder.
translation: Aria: 她有可能是不想让人把盗窃和凶杀联系起来。

original: Aria: Or perhaps she had more confidence wielding a knife over a sword.
translation: Aria: 也可能她只是觉得挥舞小刀比剑更得心应手一些。

original: Aria: Regardless of her reasons,[p/] it's clear that the Sword wasn't the murder weapon.
translation: Aria: 无论她有何种理由，[p/]那把剑显然并非凶器。

original: So she's not just being implicated in Lord Frega's murder.[p/] She's also being charged with stealing the Sword of Spell Eating.
translation: 所以她不单涉嫌谋杀弗雷加勋爵，[p/]还被指控偷走了噬法之剑。

original: But what possible reason would she have to do either of those crimes?
translation: 但她有什么犯罪动机呢？

original: Tyrion: Since the body was found here,[p/] was Lord Frega locked in this room during the lockdown?
translation: Tyrion: 既然尸体是在这里发现的，[p/]那弗雷加勋爵在封锁过程中一直呆在这里？

original: Aria: Yes.[p/] William Frega knew that this room [i]should[/i] have been secured.
translation: Aria: 对的。[p/]威廉·弗雷加知道这个房间<u>应该</u>十分安全。

original: Aria: He was supposedly in a bad mood.[p/] And had locked himself in this room for most of the night.
translation: Aria: 据说当晚他心情很差，[p/]大部分时间都把自己锁在这个书房里。

original: Aria: He refused to let anyone into the room.[p/] The only person he spoke to after that was his daughter.
translation: Aria: 他不让任何人进书房。[p/]他女儿是唯一一个在那之后和他说过话的人。

original: Tyrion: His "daughter"?[p/] Are you talking about Miriam?
translation: Tyrion: 他的“女儿”？[p/]你是指米莉亚姆？

original: Aria: No.[p/] Lord Frega had another daughter.
translation: Aria: 不是。[p/]弗雷加勋爵还有一个女儿。

original: Aria: I'm referring to Laefe Frega:[p/] Lord Frega's middle child.
translation: Aria: 我是指拉菲·弗雷加，[p/]弗雷加勋爵的二女儿。

original: Aria: She tried to tell her father about the theft,[p/] but he was apparently preoccupied with something else.
translation: Aria: 她当晚试图告诉她父亲展品失窃的事，[p/]但他当时似乎在忙其他事。

original: Aria: He said that he wanted to stay in his Study for the rest of the night.
translation: Aria: 他说他想在书房里过夜。

original: Tyrion: When did this happen?
translation: Tyrion: 这是什么时候的事？

original: Aria: It was shortly before the lockdown was activated.[p/] A little after 1:00 AM.
translation: Aria: 封锁生效前没多久。[p/]凌晨 1:00 左右。

original: Tyrion: I see...
translation: Tyrion: 我知道了……

original: Laefe must've been the last person to see Lord Frega alive then.
translation: 也就是说拉菲是最后一个看到弗雷加勋爵活着的人。
